title: R. Carlos Lamas CV
text:
Graduate Financial Economics Student  Minor In Data Science

LinkedIn Profile



Seeking Employment in Investment Research


Developed a strong understanding of financial economics that required analytical and quantitative skills.



Alternative Investing, Real Estate Finance, Algorithmic Trading.




2020 - 2024 BYU-I, Bachelor Degree in Financial Economics



June 2021 - August 2023 Etrade Financial  • Resolved customer’s problems dealing with issues related to stock and options trade  • Offered guidance on utilizing E*TRADE trading platforms for technical analysis, charts, executing trades  • Facilitated opening accounts for a variety of clients, including day traders to high-net-worth individuals • Educated customer on a general retirement contribution, Roth conversions, and recharacterizations  • Reviewed suspicious activity of money laundering. Identity theft and account takeovers • Guided customers in processing bank wires and facilitating account transfers internally and externally 



• Data Wrangling and Visualization: Preformed data analysis by cleaning and transforming data sets  • Problem-Solving: Developed analytic and critical thinking skills to break down complex problems
• Data Visualization: Visualization skills in R, power point and Excel • Programming: Strong programming skills in R, python  • Certifications: Bloomberg Certification, Harvard Excel certification in Excel  • Languages: Fluent in Spanish  • Interests: Creating personal investment models, trading options, cooking, serving in the church, following sports • Work Eligibility: Eligible to work in the U.S. with no restrictions 


• Leadership: Activity sought out team members at ETRADE who needed help with clients’ inquiries related to trading concepts, tax issues, and fraud-related questions.  • License: Previously licensed with Series 7, Series 63, and SIE through ETRADE
<!– ### Footer
Last updated: April 2024 –
